Posts.Content: kelnied wrote: Hi all, Anyone take Taxotere and Cytoxan and NOT take Emend or a substitue after?  Did you get sick or nauseated not taking it?  After my insurance, it costs $89 for 2 pills.  I talked to my Dr. about it and he said there isn't anything else comparable that goes with the anti-nausea med they give me in my IV.  But he said that he has had many women not take it and has only one that has gotten sick without it.  He said he wouldn't have a problem with me not taking it and seeing how I do.  I can always take Compazane if I get nauseated.  Anyone have any experience with this?  I can get it if it's really necessary, it would really just help us out if we could skip it since it is every 3 weeks and I am not working much right now.  Thanks! Bilateral mastectomy, latisimus dorsi reconstruction with tissue expander 8/7/09 Dx 8/13/2009, IDC, <1cm, Stage II, Grade 1, 3/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Emend kelnied Shanagirl

Posts.Content: kelnied wrote: I just joined tonight.  I have spent much time here and I have to say everyone is so encouraging - this board is full of life!  While I am battling fear, I want to say God is good all of the time.  I don't know what His plan is, but I know what the enemy has intended to do me harm, our Father will use for my good.  I need to keep reminding myself of His truths and His will for my life.  Jesus's name is power, breath and living water.  I will hold these words tight to my heart.  I want to thank everyone for sharing and encouraging me.   Bilateral mastectomy, latisimus dorsi reconstruction with tissue expander 8/7/09 Dx 8/13/2009, IDC, <1cm, Stage II, Grade 1, 3/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hello kelnied LoriL

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2009 11:38AM kelnied wrote: Thank you all for your kind words!  I too deal with simple trust - I have a long way to go on this.  But, last night after searching through this site, reading biographies left here - hoping to see women who are like me and have survived, I felt God nudge me to just leave a simple post here.  And after reading all of your words and seeing your signature line and seeing that you ladies have made it - I am very reassured.  I know I just need to stop and listen to God and where He is leading me - rather than trying to "figure it all out" by myself.  Wendy, I too have felt like my news just keeps getting  worse - had biopsies that were fine, then DCIS, then had my bilateral mastectomy and was told my nodes were clean, then get a call that the pathology showed microscopic metastasis to the lymph nodes, and going from Stage 0 with DCIS to Stage 2 and now I need chemo and radiation when I thought I could avoid any further treatment by doing mast due to DCIS - just seems like a downward spiral.  But to hear your words that it kept getting worse and then it started getting better  - is very encouraging.  Also, thanks for naming the Bible verse I was referencing - I will inscribe that unto my heart.  SpunkyGirl - I love your signature - I love that Third Day song - so encouraging! Love in Christ, Kellie
Posts.Title: Hello kelnied LoriL

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2009 05:54PM kelnied wrote: Dear Bermuda77,  Those words are beautiful!  I felt a welling of the Holy Spirit in my heart while I read it.  Just beautiful.  Thank you for sharing.
Posts.Title: Hello kelnied LoriL
